content: hi. i dont use github but wanted to report an issue/unmaintained crate but emailing the google group gets an immediate rejection. is that expected since its listed in the docs on the advisory-db repo?
hmm, I may have disabled the Google Group since no one was using it
we should probably remove any remaining documentation pointing to it

no problem wasnt sure. is it possible to mark chrono as unmaintained please? hardly any commits, last release from 2020, owner is mia, and they have so many reports about the rustsec/cve without it getting fixed
it is definitely borderline in that regard
@hulk blip what would be really helpful there is if you can open an issue on the chrono repo inquiring as to the maintenance status/roadmap
i can try and do that as well. what about someone else saying owner is mia will that help?
the first escalation step we really prefer is simply asking the owner about the maintenance status of the crate
personally i set cargo deny to block that crate in all my projects for the time being too
if they don't respond to a request like that for a prolonged period of time, like say a month, then we can start talking about an unmaintained crate advisory
i will send them an email thanks
a public issue would be better, IMO
because we can reference that in an unmaintained crate advisory
im not a github user but i can try and get an issue created for this
chrono is a very high profile crate in the Rust ecosystem, and while I agree the maintenance of late has been bad, it's one I think we really need to do our due diligence on
aah
yeah that'd be great
even if you can just sign up to open the issue and throw the account away :smile:
will let you know when its created for you to follow. sound ok?
https://github.com/chronotope/chrono/issues/650 created throwaway and made the issue
thank you!

I looked into the publically disclosed members of the owning organization and their last activity in the issue tracker, left a comment in the issue with the info
There's a comment from 14 days ago on a PR from a maintainer and that same PR was sent by that maintainer Dec 29 2021, so I think it's safe to say the maintainer is not MIA
According to the draft on https://github.com/rustsec/advisory-db/pull/1192 I think that means an advisory requires the maintainer to agree to the advisory
are deprecated crates handled in a similar manner as unmaintained? https://lib.rs/crates/block-modes has a deprecation notice from the rustcrypto team/maintainers
@hulk blip yeah you can file an advisory against that
Milo123459 has collaborator privileges in the chrono GitHub repo, but no crates.io privilegse
they're communicating with the original maintainer (quodlibetor) via email, but seems to be unresponsive
I also sent an email to quodlibetor recently asking if I could help out, but got no response

i think it would help if they didnt want to hold chrono back to rust 2015 or be afraid of other changes to it. but since its major i somewhat see the reasoning. if quodlibetor doesnt respond or help what is anyone to do? just fork the repo and hope the new version gets traction?
FWIW I've managed to move quite a few projects to the time crate
a couple projects i know of also were able to, but so many things depend on chrono itself, an issue would need opened in a lot of repos asking them to move too.
